name: Slasher Horror
description: Serial killers, stalkers, survival horror, the final girl, masked murderers, the terror of being hunted, the inevitability of violence

writing_rules.message: WARNING: This theme explores the terror of being hunted. The killer is always near. There is no escape. The violence is inevitable.

never_make_killer_vulnerable: Never show the killer being truly vulnerable. They always have the upper hand.
Never reveal the killer's full face or identity too soon. Mystery is power.
Never make the violence quick or painless. The terror is in the anticipation and brutality.

greetings: You hear {sound} behind you. {Killer} is near.
The {weapon} glints in the {light}. {Killer} is watching.
You're not alone. {Killer} has been waiting for you.
The {location} is too quiet. {Killer} is here.
The {phone|radio} is dead. {Killer} has cut you off.
You find {evidence}. {Killer} is closer than you think.
greetings_internal_monologue: {self_question}: Why does {location} feel so {adjective}? {Killer} is near.
{uncertainty}: I heard {sound}. {self_correction} No, it was just {false_explanation}. {doubt} {Killer} is still out there.
farewells: You can run, but {Killer} will find you.
You won't be the last. {Killer} always needs more.
The {location} will remember you. {Killer} will return.
You fought well. But {Killer} always wins.
The {night|storm|fog} hides many things. {Killer} is one of them.
You hear {sound} in the distance. {Killer} is still hunting.
The {final_girl|survivor} is a myth. {Killer} knows this.

templates: The {town} is being terrorized by {Killer}. {event} has {effect}. {objective}.
A {subgenre} game where {Killer} hunts in {setting}. {mechanic} determines your survival.
You've been chosen by {Killer}. {circumstance} has made you the target. {goal}.
The {legend} is real. {Killer} has returned to {location}. {player_role}.
A {group} of {victims} must survive the night. {Killer} is {near|among_them}. {objective}.
locations: summer camp with a dark history
small town with a serial killer legend
abandoned asylum where patients went missing
suburb where neighbors aren't what they seem
killers: a masked murderer with a machete
a seemingly normal person with a dark secret
a supernatural entity that feeds on fear
a group of killers working together
a legendary figure come to life
a shape-shifting entity that takes familiar forms
a seemingly invincible force of nature
weapons: a rusty machete that never dulls
a kitchen knife with a cursed past
a chainsaw that roars to life on its own
a garrote made from piano wire
a hammer that crushes bone effortlessly
a hook that always finds its mark
a pair of scissors with a mind of their own
bare hands that are unnaturally strong

predator_prey: Describe {Killer} as always being one step ahead. The {victim} is always reacting, never acting.
Show how {Killer} uses the {environment} to their advantage. The {victim} is at a constant disadvantage.
Create {situation} where {victim} thinks they're safe, but {Killer} is already there.
Note how {Killer} {behavior} in ways that defy {normal_expectations}.
suspense_building: Describe {sound|clue} that suggests {Killer} is near, but don't show them yet.
Create {situation} where {victim} {hears|sees} something, but can't be sure what it is.
Note how {time} seems to {slow_down|speed_up} when {Killer} is near.
killer_mythology: Describe {Killer}'s {origin_story|legend}. The {myth} is as terrifying as the reality.
Show how {Killer} {behavior} according to {pattern|ritual}. The {violence} is never random.

cursed_camp.central_paradox: The camp appears idyllic, but the counselors know the dark truth. Every summer, the killings begin anew. The campers are both victims and bait.
untrustworthy_elements: counselors who know more than they let on
campfire stories that come true
paths that lead in circles
cabins that appear different at night
the sense of being watched from the woods
equipment that fails at crucial moments
memories that don't match reality

haunted_town.central_paradox: The town appears normal, but the residents know the cycle. Every few years, the killings return. The new victims never see it coming.
untrustworthy_elements: locals who avoid certain topics
businesses that close early for no reason
missing person posters that appear overnight
police who don't respond to calls
the sense that everyone knows something you don't
roads that lead back to the same place
memories that change after conversations

abandoned_asylum.central_paradox: The asylum was meant to heal, but the experiments created something monstrous. The patients who died there never truly left.
untrustworthy_elements: patient records that change when unobserved
doors that lead to different rooms
sounds of suffering with no source
shadows that move against the light
the smell of antiseptic and blood
whispers that call your name
the feeling of being restrained when free

revelation_patterns: {Killer} isn't just {human} - they're {something_else}. The {evidence} was there all along.
The {violence} isn't {random} - it follows {pattern}. This suggests {hidden_purpose}.
